title: Hartley & Marks
content: Canadian specialty publishers, headquartered in Vancouver. Among other areas of expertise, Hartley & Marks have published many books on typography, including [Robert Bringhurst](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829233955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Robert%20Bringhurst)'s Elements of Typographic Style, [Gerrit Noordzij](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829233955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Gerrit%20Noordzij)'s Letterletter, [Stanley Morison](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829233955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Stanley%20Morison)'s Letter Forms and [Robert Bringhurst](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829233955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Robert%20Bringhurst) and [Warren Chappell](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829233955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Warren%20Chappell)'s Brief History of the Printed Word. Along with [Hyphen Press](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829233955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hyphen%20Press), one of the most significant publishers in English of typographic materials.
author: Forrest L Norvell
